oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fisk University Library (Cravath Hall)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hibbs, Henry, architect
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Artists
Academic libraries; Library buildings; Fisk University (Nashville, Tenn.); African American universities and colleges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Designed by architect Henry Hibbs in 1929-1930, Cravath Hall is a neo-Gothic building and is named after the first president of Fisk University. The architect's granddaughter, Harriet Hall Cates, was in charge of the 1998 rehabilitation of the building.
